DESCRIPTION: Minimal basis sets: use a fixed number of Gaussian primitive functions to represent core and valence orbitals.
Split-valence basis sets: represent valence orbitals by more than one basis function. They include 'Pople' and correlation-consistent basis sets.
Plane-wave basis sets: use a finite number of plane-wave functions
Real-space basis sets: functions are centered on a uniform mesh in real space.
